page.title: 04HEALTH IN DONCASTER
page.content: IN ANY PERIOD OF TEN YEARS THERE ARE TRENDS WHERE DISEASES INCREASE OR DECREASE. IN THE NEXT TEN YEARS MORE MONEY WILL BE SPENT ON PREVENTING AND CURING DISEASE. THE AIM OF PREVENTATIVE MEDICINE IS TO STOP DISEASE OCCURRING BY VACCINATION AND IMMUNISATION. THE VACCINES ARE BEING CONSTANTLY IMPROVED. THE BIRTH RATE AT THE MOMENT IS RISING. THE POPULATION OF DONCASTER IS 287,000 AND THE BIRTH RATE WAS 3.5%. IN 1984 CERTAIN PARTS OF DONCASTER SUCH AS BENTLEY (A SMALL PIT VILLAGE) HAD A HIGHER BIRTH RATE THAN OTHERS. THERE IS A MAIN GENERAL HOSPITAL FOR THE DISTRICT OF DONCASTER CALLED THE DONCASTER ROYAL INFIRMARY.
